channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: 'Pacific neighbours in far greater need' of travel bubble - specialist workers
item.description: Two of the country's busiest airports have sketched out their plans for an international travel bubble should the government announce one. But the wait is frustrating specialist workers here.

item.title: 'I wish that society would be accepting'
item.description: The Detail - The man who helped write guidelines on transgender players in women's rugby says he hates that his work has created a platform for people to attack transgender people as cheats.

item.title: Foreigners stranded in NZ call for extension to visas
item.description: Some foreigners stuck in New Zealand are making concerted pleas to stay.

item.title: China retaliates over New Zealand’s Hong Kong extradition treaty suspension
item.description: China said on Monday it will suspend its extradition agreement with New Zealand in response to Wellington suspending its existing extradition treaty with Hong Kong, Reuters reports.

item.title: James Shaw on national climate change risk assessment: 'Forewarned is forearmed'
item.description: The first national climate change risk assessment provides a specific snapshot of the risk, and now New Zealand must respond, Climate Change Minister James Shaw says.

item.title: Married doctor's affair with married patient: Ordered to apologise and undergo mentoring
item.description: A family doctor who had a personal relationship with a patient has been ordered to apologise to the patient's wife of more than 20 years.

item.title: Government accused of ignoring dangerous Napier to Taupō highway
item.description: Truckies and local leaders are at breaking point over a dangerous highway between Napier and Taupō, where eight people have been killed in the last year.

item.title: Investigation launched into abuse claims at Auckland gymnastics club
item.description: An Auckland gymnastics club is reeling over allegations of over-training and abusive coaching styles, sparking an investigation and calls for other victims to come forward.

item.title: Ngapaki Gripp murder trial: Porirua attack 'vicious and sudden'
item.description: Ngapaki Gripp is on trial for murder in the High Court at Wellington. He's charged over the death of Hone Pawa last May. Pawa died after being stabbed six times during a fight.

item.title: Mourners remember former All Black Andy Haden at Eden Park service
item.description: Former All Black Andy Haden told the Crusaders' coach Scott "Razor" Robertson that his dying wish was for the Blues to beat the Crusaders at Eden Park in just under a fortnight.

item.title: Travel bubble: Auckland Airport announces separate zones at terminal
item.description: Auckland Airport has announced its international terminal will be separated into two zones in anticipation of a travel bubble.

item.title: More Māori, Pasifika in damp, mouldy homes than previously reported
item.description: The proportion of Māori and Pasifika living in damp or mouldy housing is even worse than earlier figures suggested, Statistics New Zealand now says.

item.title: Man accused of murdering police officer appeals to keep name suppression
item.description: The man accused of murdering Constable Matthew Hunt will argue for name suppression in the Court of Appeal.

item.title: Retrial begins for Ben Swann, former school teacher accused of abusing teenage boys
item.description: A lawyer representing former Auckland school teacher Benjamin Swann, who is accused of abusing six teenage boys, says his client is innocent.

item.title: Calls for independent complaints authority for Fire and Emergency
item.description: A group of current and former firefighters who say they have been sexually assaulted, bullied and harassed at work want an independent complaints authority established.

item.title: Name suppression extended for officers accused of manslaughter
item.description: Their interim name suppression was due to lapse at 4pm today but it will continue after they appealled.

item.title: Orion accused of impeding Port Hills fire investigation
item.description: Council owned lines company Orion has been accused at the High Court in Christchurch of making it difficult to properly investigate the cause of the 2017 Port Hills fires.

item.title: Covid-19: Two new cases in managed isolation facilities
item.description: The first case is a male teenager who arrived in NZ from the USA, and the second is a man in his 20s who arrived from Switzerland via Amsterdam and Seoul.
